alert.note: Alert for Jefferson; Oswego (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued September 27 at 9:20AM EDT until September 27 at 3:15PM EDT by NWS Buffalo
info.description: The National Weather Service in Buffalo has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... South Central Jefferson County in central New York... North Central Oswego County in central New York... * Until 315 PM EDT. * At 920 AM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy lake effect rain across extreme northern Oswego and extreme southern Jefferson counties. Between 2 and 4 inches of rain have fallen near Sandy Pond. Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Sandy Pond, Sandy Creek, Mannsville. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
